results.title: District Commissioner
results.creator_credit: Maslyn Williams, Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Australia today”.
The work of a District Commissioner in the Papua New Guinea highlands. Follows Tom Ellis on patrol: establishing medical posts, providing agricultural advice and equipment, taking a populaiton census and later establishing a patrol post. Shows the importance of air-dropped supplies, until airstrips and roads are laid, and the value of roads to primitive people.

results.title: Distribution of plants and animals
results.creator_credit: William Peltz, John Walker and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Biology program; unit 1. Ecology”.
Studies plant and animal ecology. Traces the various factors which influence the distribution and survival of animals in a given geographical area. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Distribution of foods
results.brief_description: Studies the technological advances made in the methods of preserving and transporting foodstuffs, showing their relation to the distribution of perishable foods on a world scale, the flow of foods from producer to consumer, the problems which a limited family income raises, and the international trade and tariff barriers.

results.title: Distributing heat energy
results.brief_description: Coal, Gas, oil, electricity and wood are all sources of heat. Coal, oil, and gas are used as furnace fuels. Home heating has developed from the colonial fireplace of the early American settler to the modern steam, gas, or electric radiator. Heat transfer is carried out by conduction, convection, and radiation. All these points are studied in this film.

results.title: Distinguished guests
results.creator_credit: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Christopher (Colin Friels) is sure he really likes psychology - but not the way it is taught at his university. Professor Wiseman, his tutor, is a disciple of the eminent European pyschologist, Professor Eisenbach - a cold rational behaviourist whose books are always cited as authorities. As a joke, Christopher and his girlfriend decide that he will impersonate Eisenbach and teach Professor Wiseman a lesson. Co-written by PJ Hogan (Muriel’s Wedding). Also features Tracy Mann.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Loretta Fisher, P.J. Hogan, Louise Meek and AFTRS

results.title: Distinctively Australian
results.creator_credit: Mark Falzon, Michael Edols and Central Coast Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Under southern skies”.
Series presenter, Dr Susie Hanckel, leaves her city environment to examine what makes the ecosystems in our 400million year old country distinctively Australian. She looks at the adaptation of plants to the extremes of Australian climatic conditions - from the arid deserts and the snow covered eucalypts of the Australian Alps to the rainforests of North Queensland. This episode features distinguished scientist and specialist on Australia’s High Country, Alec Costain.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mark Falzon, Michael Edols and Central Coast Media
